Method Detail

test_2_2_5_1_MediaServerSendsBye

public void test_2_2_5_1_MediaServerSendsBye()
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
Media Server terminates the SIP session with BYE
  1. Create a NetworkConnection. As the MS initiated BYE is received
  2. a MEDIA_SERVER_SDP_CHANGED event triggered the listener and
  3. the local SDP is cleared.
  4. Server emulator is com.hp.opencall.jmsc.test.mandatory.robustness.MSFaultTestServer.Test_ms_send_bye

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

test_2_2_5_2_MediaServerRejectSDP

public void test_2_2_5_2_MediaServerRejectSDP()
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
Media Server rejects initial INIVITE carrying SDP, in most case modifying local SDP fails.
  1. Create a NetworkConnection. As the MS responses with 451 Media type not supported
  2. a Error.REFUSED event triggered the listener.
  3. Server emulator is com.hp.opencall.jmsc.test.mandatory.robustness.MSFaultTestServer.Test_MS_Reject_SDP

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

test_2_2_5_3_MediaServerSendsReInvite

public void test_2_2_5_3_MediaServerSendsReInvite()
                                           throws java.lang.Exception
Media Server manipulates SIP Session by sending re-Invite.
  1. Create a NetworkConnection. As the MS initiated Re-Invite is received
  2. a MEDIA_SERVER_SDP_CHANGED event triggered the listener and
  3. a new local SDP is set. After the new remote SDP has been obtained, modify
  4. method is called again to inform MS the new remote SDP.
  5. This modify method is synchronized and returned as ACK is received.
  6. Server emulator is com.hp.opencall.jmsc.test.mandatory.robustness.MSFaultTestServer.test_ms_reInvite

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

test_2_2_5_4_MediaServerRejectReinvite

public void test_2_2_5_4_MediaServerRejectReinvite()
                                            throws java.lang.Exception
Media Server rejects re-Invite for Mixer
  1. Create a NetworkConnection and join with Mixer
  2. the re-Invite to configure the leg is rejected by MS
  3. a exception should warn the application.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
